sub_title: Student at Radboud Universiteit Nijmegen & Rijksuniversiteit Groningen
summary:
I like learning about anything I have a remote interest in and indulge myself in it. Find out everything there is to know, try to work it out myself, read, ask others, then prove it to myself. Only to finally come across what is not yet known or worse: cannot be known. Then I repeat the process with another subject.

I am a perfectionist. I love optimizing things. In fact I can hardly quit doing it, in real life (e.g. groceries), study or occupation, I'm obsessed with finding the perfect answer. There always is a perfect answer. Even if the answer is that there is no solution, or if it is proven that the answer is impossible to find, it must exist, somewhere. Such is my philosophy.

I am a competitive being. I want to improve. I want to win. Once I commit to something I will do anything, I will do the research, I will optimize my preparation, I will overhaul my lifestyle if there is another percent to be gained. Nothing within my own power will stand between me and victory.

I think about everything. I carefully observe and analyze. In groups, my strategy is to adapt to the people surrounding me. I believe the strongest bonds are created when you blend in perfectly. I follow the way of the chamaeleon.

I am versatile and specialized. Find me something interesting, find me something in which I can excel. Tell me how I can be of use to you and I will soon be so.

awards.title: World Champion Axis & Allies Revised 2012
awards.description:
(The tournament took nearly a year to complete; that is why the date is 2013 while the title says 2012.)

As a co-developer and fervent player of the game variant called 'Enhanced' I decided to prove my skills to the community by competing - and right-away winning - the most prestigious international tournament under the more widely accepted 'Revised' ruleset. I was set to defend my title next year as I made it to the final but couldn't finish the match due to personal circumstances.

projects.title: Student Company
projects.description: A new project within the academic setting of the university was set up to bring students together who want to experience entrepreneurship. Guided by the step-by-step program of the 'Jong Ondernemen' Foundation our multidisciplinary team consisting of a handful of students will go through the process of creating our very own start-up company.

projects.title: Hot Shot / Blue Moon / Poker at the Penthouse
projects.description: Throughout the years I've taken the responsibility to organize poker tournaments of professional quality in Nijmegen, Groningen and Enschede. Excluding the ones I have directed for student organizations, my anniversary 10th multi-day tournament was played last fall.

profile_positions.title: Private Tutor

volunteer_experiences.description: Chess Club De Stelling had been recently founded by a father who has two sons talented in chess. Lacking a chess club in the neighborhood he started one himself at the local primary school. It quickly gained popularity and not before long the players at the club were performing in regional tournaments, which is how I noticed them. I felt a strong drive to further this initiative and as a decent chess player I felt that this is the kind of place where I could make a difference.

This school is the only one in the whole metropolitan area that had chess as part of their mandatory curriculum. I have always been a proponent of this, as it furthers the development of certain important brain areas that I feel are neglected in the current school system, notably abstract thinking. There have been great results with it in the US and Russia. I volunteered to experience this project first hand. I was unfortunately heavily leashed by the principal and the chess teacher acted more like a grandfather than a teacher towards the children, keeping the lessons far too informal. There was no order in the class room and the children saw it more like an hour off where they could chit-chat while moving some pieces rather than a place to learn. This was also frowned upon by the other teachers at the school. Without any power to change the status quo I regretfully saw how the project would get terminated.
